title: Spec/templates and generators for governed surfaces
scope: Define canonical spec sources (intents/tasks/requirements) and the generators that produce governed surfaces.
Ensure human-readable Markdown outputs are generated only from templates and JSON sources.
Do not introduce machine-specific paths or coupling to other repos.
acceptance: `npm run generate` produces docs/status/portal surfaces deterministically from canonical sources.
No generated `.md` files require hand-edits; drift is detectable via `npm run generate:check`.
Generators are structured so adding a new surface is incremental.

deliverables.title: Generators for docs/status/portal surfaces from spec sources
acceptance: Generator reads canonical sources and emits governed surfaces deterministically.
Templates cover intents/tasks/requirements and key docs surfaces.
evidence: `npm run generate` completes successfully and updates generated surfaces.

deliverables.title: Canonical templates for governed JSON specs (intent/task/requirements)
acceptance: Templates reflect current governance standards (scope, acceptance, deliverables, subtasks).

subtasks.title: Define canonical sources and ensure generators read only those sources.
done_when: Generators read from `spec/intents/*.json`, `spec/tasks/*.json`, and requirements bundle entrypoint.
No generator depends on machine-specific paths.

subtasks.title: Generate human-readable docs surfaces from `.mdt` templates (no hand-edits).
done_when: All `.md` outputs include generated frontmatter and are derived from templates.
Deterministic generation is verifiable via `npm run generate:check`.

subtasks.title: Generate portal/status JSON surfaces used by the internal portal.
done_when: Portal/status JSON outputs are generated from canonical specs.
Outputs include enough data for portal navigation without reading the repo.
